results.abstract: Home Video column on DVD releases of several movie classics, as well as first season of television's The Simpsons; photos (M)

headline.main: Old Favorites in a New Format

results.snippet: In the introduction to ''The Simpsons: The Complete First Season,'' one of a dozen or so DVD's of the year, Matt Groening, the show's creator, urges you to go right on buying each of the 12 seasons as they appear before DVD goes out of style and the...
results.lead_paragraph: In the introduction to ''The Simpsons: The Complete First Season,'' one of a dozen or so DVD's of the year, Matt Groening, the show's creator, urges you to go right on buying each of the 12 seasons as they appear before DVD goes out of style and the next format comes along. (If this were 1989, Homer Simpson would tell you to do it with a credit card that doesn't set off that terrible beeping.) With DVD exploding, you may have at least a dozen years. Distributors scrambled all year to supply big new movies and an eclectic stream of older ones. ''Jurassic Park III'' and ''Pearl Harbor'' crowded in with ''Ben-Hur,'' ''Lawrence of Arabia,'' ''Some Like It Hot,'' ''The Godfather DVD Collection,'' ''Citizen Kane,'' ''The French Connection,'' ''The Longest Day'' and ''Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs.''
